required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Reducing Veterans Hospitalizations From Community Living Centers
clinical_study.official_title: Implementing and Evaluating INTERACT in VA CLCs

lead_sponsor.agency: VA Office of Research and Development

clinical_study.source: VA Office of Research and Development

brief_summary.textblock: The goal of the project was to implement and evaluate the intervention, Interventions to Reduce Acute Care Transfers (INTERACT) in VHA CLCs, which is designed to improve the care of Veterans using CLCs who experience acute changes in their condition and at the same time reduce their rate of hospitalization.

detailed_description.textblock:
The project was designed to show that engagement by frontline CLC staff, in using the INTERACT (VA version of INTERACT) program will identify Veterans' clinical problems earlier, help evaluate and safely initiate management of acute changes in conditions in the CLC, communicate more effectively with physicians about Veterans' conditions, thereby avoiding unnecessary hospitalizations, and provide more emergent hospitalizations when necessary.
The project planned to implement the INTERACT quality improvement program as the intervention in up to 15 randomly selected, pair matched CLCs for a 6 month intensive training period and an additional 12-18 month ongoing follow-up monitoring period.
Additionally, a quantitative and qualitative evaluation of the implementation of the INTERACT intervention was done to characterize the fidelity with which CLCs in the intervention pairs participated in training, engaged in regular conference calls, undertook root cause analyses identifying why hospitalizations occurred and used the tools in which they were trained.
The program's effect is based on three core strategies: 1) enabling front-line NH staff to identify acute conditions early in their course, thereby helping to prevent them from becoming severe enough to require acute hospitalization; 2) providing communication and decision support tools that assist with the safe and effective management of certain conditions in the Community Living Center (CLC) without transfer to the acute hospital; and 3) educating CLC staff in advance care planning and discussions about end-of-life and comfort care plans, and thus increasing the use of advance directives, comfort care measures, and palliative and hospice care as an alternative to hospitalization when appropriate.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Pair matched cluster randomized trial; randomization at the provider level.
study_design_info.masking_description: Intervention implemented in providers assigned to experimental condition, so all knew they were in a study. Control facilities did not know there was a study underway.

primary_outcome.measure: Hospital Admissions Per Person Year Alive Measured at the Facility Month Level
primary_outcome.description: hospital admissions from nursing home per person year at risk of being hospitalized calculated for each of the 16 facilities per month of observation during the 18 months of the active study and 18 months preceding introduction of the intervention in the experimental facilities. This measure is constructed from EMR data and not from a scale.

secondary_outcome.description: Potentially avoidable hospitalization per person year alive aggregated to the facility level. These hospitalizations are a sub-set of all hospitalizations based upon an AHRQ algorithm frequently referenced in the literature.

arm_group.description: Eight VA CLCs selected to receive the INTERACT intervention
Eight CLCs, matched to experiment CLCs, based on size, location to VAMC, and hospitalization rates, did not receive the intervention and continued care as usual

intervention.intervention_name: Interventions to Reduce Acute Care Transfers
intervention.description: Experimental CLCs were trained in INTERACT QI Intervention, containing tools, strategies and educational resources designed to catch and manage acute changes in conditions early that a Veteran may be experiencing, leading to a potential reduction in preventable hospital transfers from CLCs.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Veterans in experimental and control CLCs during 18 months during which the INTERAC intervention was implemented.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Veterans not in participating CLCs

overall_official.affiliation: Providence VA Medical Center, Providence, RI

facility.name: Providence VA Medical Center, Providence, RI

link.description: Click here for more information about this study: Implementing and Evaluating INTERACT in VA CLCs

results_reference.citation: Mochel AL, Henry ND, Saliba D, Phibbs CS, Ouslander JG, Mor V. INTERACT in VA Community Living Centers (CLCs): Training and Implementation Strategies. Geriatr Nurs. 2018 Mar - Apr;39(2):212-218. doi: 10.1016/j.gerinurse.2017.09.002. Epub 2017 Oct 5.

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

participant_flow.recruitment_details: All Veterans admitted to any of the eight experimental and eight control facilities (VA Community Living Centers) during the study timeframe, January 2016 - December 2017.

group.title: Experimental VA Community Living Centers
group.description: Eight VA CLCs selected to receive the INTERACT intervention Interventions to Reduce Acute Care Transfers: Experimental CLCs were trained in INTERACT QI Intervention, containing tools, strategies and educational resources designed to catch and manage acute changes in conditions early that a Veteran may be experiencing, leading to a potential reduction in preventable hospital transfers from CLCs.

group.description: Eight CLCs, matched to experiment CLCs, based on size, location to VAMC, and hospitalization rates, did not receive the intervention and continued care as usual

This measure is constructed from EMR data and not from a scale.

group.description: Eight VA CLCs selected to receive the INTERACT intervention Interventions to Reduce Acute Care Transfers: Experimental CLCs were trained in INTERACT QI Intervention, containing tools, strategies and educational resources designed to catch and manage acute changes in conditions early that a Veteran may be experiencing, leading to a potential reduction in preventable hospital transfers from CLCs.

measure.title: Hospital Admissions Per Person Year Alive Measured at the Facility Month Level
measure.description: hospital admissions from nursing home per person year at risk of being hospitalized calculated for each of the 16 facilities per month of observation during the 18 months of the active study and 18 months preceding introduction of the intervention in the experimental facilities. This measure is constructed from EMR data and not from a scale.

analysis.groups_desc: We assumed the average monthly pre-intervention hospitalization rates of intervention and control CLCs were equal, so only average monthly post-intervention hospitalization rates might diverge. Each CLC had its own start month and contributed 18 months pre-intervention and 18 months post-intervention. Hospitalizations rates were modeled using a multilevel negative-binomial regression because it allows for over-dispersion, which is commonly observed with medical events such as a count.

outcome.title: Potentially Avoidable Hospitalizations
outcome.description: Potentially avoidable hospitalization per person year alive aggregated to the facility level. These hospitalizations are a sub-set of all hospitalizations based upon an AHRQ algorithm frequently referenced in the literature.

measure.title: Potentially Avoidable Hospitalizations

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse event data were collected during the study timeframe (18 Months, introduction of intervention, implementation and monitoring) for the eight experimental CLC Veterans and eight controls
reported_events.desc: To ensure the safety of Veterans in the CLC and confirm the intervention is not reducing hospitalizations to the detriment of Veterans’, we had a safety monitoring plan in place which was reviewed and signed off by the Data Safety Monitoring Board (DSMB) and we generated mortality data for all CLC residents in both INTERACT (experimental) and control facilities, charting changes in mortality rates relative to the historical and contemporary mortality rates of paired facilities.

group.title: Experimental VA Community Living Centers
group.description: Eight VA CLCs selected to receive the INTERACT intervention Interventions to Reduce Acute Care Transfers: Experimental CLCs were trained in INTERACT QI Intervention, containing tools, strategies and educational resources designed to catch and manage acute changes in conditions early that a Veteran may be experiencing, leading to a potential reduction in preventable hospital transfers from CLCs.

group.title: Control VA Community Living Centers
group.description: Eight CLCs, matched to experiment CLCs, based on size, location to VAMC, and hospitalization rates, did not receive the intervention and continued care as usual

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: Our intervention and control CLCs were not perfectly matched. Due to incomplete implementation of INTERACT in all intervention sites, we acknowledge that this was an incomplete test of the efficacy of the program when properly implemented
